meanings.definition: To cut off the end or tip of something.
meanings.sent1: She couped the rope to make it fit the hook.
meanings.sent2: The barber couped the hair to give a neat look.
meanings.sent3: The chef couped the vegetables for a quick stir-fry.
meanings.sent4: The tailor couped the fabric with precision.
meanings.sent5: He couped the excess paper to tidy up the edges.

meanings.definition: To have a tail or part of the body cut short.
meanings.sent1: The dog's tail was couped due to an injury.
meanings.sent2: The horse's mane was couped for the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur was couped by accident during grooming.
meanings.sent4: The bird's feathers were couped for a sleek appearance.
meanings.sent5: The sheep's wool was couped for the summer heat.

meanings.definition: To be shortened or reduced in length.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was couped to save time.
meanings.sent2: The movie was couped for a faster pace.
meanings.sent3: The story was couped to fit in the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: The speech was couped to keep the audience engaged.
meanings.sent5: The song was couped to make it more catchy.
